Description: Fragment of marble astragal. with bead-and-reel moulding with flat bed above. Fragment of the upper or lower edge of the front side of a square, which was decorated with a massive (H 5,6 cm) and very accurate worked out astragal. The axis of the astragal was indicated by scratch lines. A further horizontal scratch line is visible on the smooth sanded square front side. Traces of red paint found on the pendentive between the beads, reels and the square edge. Light grey marble
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (Attributed by Petrie to the 'second temple of Apollo'.)
Curator's comments: The dimension between axes (15,6 cm) of the corresponding cymas is longer than ever other yet documented fragments (Koenigs 2007). Published (Petrie 1886, Pl. 14 A left)
Bibliographic references: Sculpture / Catalogue of Greek Sculpture in the British Museum (B418)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIV A, left centre)
Koenigs 2007 / Archaische griechische Bauteile (Cat. no.32, p.336, pl. 21, 23)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (AA.41) (Phase 3)
